meanings.sent1: I joggle the table to fix the wobbly leg.
meanings.sent2: She likes to joggle her baby gently to help them fall asleep.
meanings.sent3: The earthquake made the whole house joggle!
meanings.sent4: His sudden shout joggled me out of my daydream.
meanings.sent5: The train's movement made everything joggle in the cabin.

meanings.sent1: The joggle of the train woke me up from my nap.
meanings.sent2: I felt a joggle in my pocket and realized my phone was ringing.
meanings.sent3: The joggle of the rollercoaster made me laugh.
meanings.sent4: The joggle of the earthquake was felt throughout the city.
meanings.sent5: The joggle of the car ride made me feel queasy.

meanings.definition: A joint between two pieces of timber or metal, allowing movement.
meanings.sent1: The joggle in the bridge allows it to expand and contract with the weather.
meanings.sent2: The joggle in the pipe prevents it from breaking under pressure.
meanings.sent3: The joggle in the door made it swing open unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: The joggle in the machinery keeps it running smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The joggle in the fence allows it to flex during strong winds.
